body_html:
The unit test is either wrong, or doesn't actually test repeats correctly.

On Nov 20, 2016 10:10 AM, "Ling Zhang" notifications@github.com wrote:

Actually yeah, I investigated further and it was just that I did not make
the seq_len long enough to allow for the blanks to be between the labels,
so thus "No Valid Path Found"

Though I'm confused about your earlier comment @ebrevdo
https://github.com/ebrevdo where you said it's not the documentation
but the code that is wrong. The unit test linked and @igormq
https://github.com/igormq seems to show merge_repeated demonstrating
the correct behavior?

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
#5194 (comment),
or mute the thread
https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtimz6ECS67TyVxKr4Xvcxboa0bJzknks5rAI0RgaJpZM4KgErU
.

body:
The unit test is either wrong, or doesn't actually test repeats correctly.

On Nov 20, 2016 10:10 AM, "Ling Zhang" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Actually yeah, I investigated further and it was just that I did not make
> the seq_len long enough to allow for the blanks to be between the labels,
> so thus "No Valid Path Found"
> 
> Though I'm confused about your earlier comment @ebrevdo
> https://github.com/ebrevdo where you said it's not the documentation
> but the code that is wrong. The unit test linked and @igormq
> https://github.com/igormq seems to show merge_repeated demonstrating
> the correct behavior?
